http:\/\/purl.org\/dc\/elements\/1.1\/ti.value: Ontology for the Annotation of Push-Notifications

http:\/\/www.w3.org\/2004\/02\/skos\/cor.value: Notifications that encourage subscribers to create and/or log into an account to take advantage of a certain feature.
The notification makes subscribers aware of information that does not need further investigation by the subscriber, e.g., a new feature, upcoming holiday, weather, stock price, score in a match, etc.
A campaign to promote general awareness of a topic.
A campaign to promote new content that has just been created.
A campaign to get help or tips and to provide feedback.
A campaign directed at loyal / returning / engaged users or customers.
Informative campaign containing 'things of interest' to the user.
A campaign to induct users with a product/service, to acquaint them with features available or account management.
A campaign to promote a particular product/feature.
A campaign to promote flash sale offers, i.e., they have some time limit associated.
A campaign to promote general offers for the users.
A campaign to promote a service/product associated with particular seasons and/or holidays/events.
A campaign enticing users / customers to re-engage with the service.
A campaign based on or associated with social tools, social media or influencers.
Notifications that encourage the subscribers to click and claim some prize or reward from the application.
Targeting users based on their country of residence.
Notifications that tease the content of the information itself to generate curiosity on the users and lead them to engage with the app.
Notifications to get the subscriber to download some asset.
Targeting users based on their engagement with the app, e.g., they have liked a video, followed another user, started a game.
Targeting users based on their family status, e.g., new parents, pregnancies.
Notifications to get the subscriber to provide some form of feedback or response, for instance on the app's functionalities.
Targeting users based on their health status.
The notification is likely only relevant leading up to, during or just after a holiday period (e.g. Christmas, Father's Day, International Earth Day, World Radio Day, International Women's Day etc.)
Targeting users based on their interests, personal motivations or lifestyle.
Targeting users who have a particular interest, e.g., football goal updates indicates an interest in sports and a new recipe an interest in cooking.
Targeting users based on their particular lifestyle, e.g., vegan products, a person who runs or works out.
Targeting a segment of users who are particularly loyal, e.g., daily recurrent users.
Targeting users based on their aspirations or motivations, e.g., find a new job, get fitter, learn a new skill.
The notification is likely only relevant within a number of days within the next week.
The notification is likely only relevant within a number of hours in the current day.
The notification is likely only relevant within a number of minutes in the current hour.
The notification is likely only relevant within a number of weeks.
Targeting users who have engaged with or expressed interest in rare events, e.g., previously purchased during a holiday.
Information about personal motivations.
Notifications related with gaming apps, where the subscriber is encouraged to re-engage with the game.
Targeting users who have engaged with or expressed interest in a specific product, e.g., you will love the new X product just launched.
Notifications to get the subscriber to purchase a product or service.
Targeting users who have previously purchased or require a reason, incentive or nudge to purchase, e.g., you previously bought X, we recommend Y; 30% sale on now.
Targeting users based on their geographic region, i.e., a location within a country.
Notifications that serve as a reminder or alert to the users or provide advice / tips.
Targeting users based on their type of residence, e.g., their house contains a garden.
The notification is likely only relevant during a season e.g. Winter, Summer, Autumn, Spring.
Notifications that encourage the subscriber to engage with social tools e.g. share, like, comment, reply.

The notification is likely to remain relevant indefinitely into the future. It could relevant for months, years or an indefinite amount of time! Only select this category if the notification is not applicable to any of the other categories.

The notification is likely only relevant until some action has occurred which makes it no longer relevant or redundant (e.g. a notification asking the user to sign-in is only relevant until the user has signed in. Similarly, a notification which asks the user to claim their reward is only relevant until they have claimed their reward).
Notifications that encourage the user to watch some content on the application.
User created an account to use the application.
The name of the application
Indicates the type of personal data that can be inferred from the notification.
Indicates the application type
Indicates the call to action of the notification
Indicates the campaign type of the notification
Indicates the target audience of the notification
Indicates if the application includes paid features/services
Indicates the date and time when the application was installed
Indicates weather the notification is urgent, i.e. time-sensitive, or not.
Unique identifier of the notification
Text content of the notification, including emojis
Indicates the number of times that the application was downloaded
Indicates the number of reviews that the application has on the app store
Indicates the app that pushed the notification
Date and time when the notification is pushed by the application
Indicates the urgency of the notification - the period of time when the notification remains relevant for the user
Indicates if the application requires the creation of an account to use
Indicates the size of the application in megabytes
Indicates the mean number of stars given by the users to the application

Computer program or software application designed to run on a mobile device such as a phone, tablet, or watch. Mobile applications often stand in contrast to desktop applications which are designed to run on desktop computers, and web applications which run in mobile web browsers rather than directly on the mobile device.
Targeting users based on their geographic whereabouts.
A campaign based on promotional offers for the users.
Targeting users based on their interests, personal motivations or lifestyle.
Targeting users based on quantifiable characteristics such as family status or job experience.
Targeting users based on their behavior, purchase intent and interaction with certain online services or products.
Indicates the audience being targeted by the notification, based on their behavior or other demographic, geographic or psychographic characteristics.

Push notifications are pop-up messages, sent by mobile or browser applications, that appear on the users’ devices. Subscribers can be anywhere and still receive these messages as long as they’re online or have their browsers running on their devices.

The urgency of the notification - if it contains information that is only relevant for a certain period of time and becomes redundant if that period of time passes (for example, a notification about Friday night is irrelevant if delivered on Saturday morning).

Indicates the campaign type of the notification, based on the marketing strategy followed by a company to keeps its brand's visibility, i.e., to mantain and increase the number of notification subscribers.
The call-to-action of the notification - for example, 'Anne sent you a message on App X' is encouraging the user to interact with the app to communicate with other people.
Indicates personal information that can be derived or inferred from the notification.
